greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Draw n rays from each of two distinct points in the plane; a(n) is the number of edges thus created. See Comments for details.
comment: The rays are evenly spaced around each point. The first ray of one point goes in the opposite direction of the other point. Should a ray hit the other point, it terminates there, i.e., it is converted to a line segment.
formula: Conjectured by _Stefano Spezia_, Oct 08 2020 after _Lars Blomberg_: (Start)
_Hugo Pfoertner_, Oct 08 2020: It appears that even terms are 4*A000096+2, odd terms 4*A000124-1.
results.author: _Lars Blomberg_, Oct 08 2020
